instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]MBP retina 2015 13’' 820-4924 won’t sleep
threads.message: Got a a1502 2015 model with liquid damage around u3310, replaced a few burned components. The MacBook works perfect, it just won’t sleep when the lid is shut. any ideas what it could be?

threads.title: [SOLVED]MBP retina 2015 13’' 820-4924 won’t sleep
threads.message:
The magnetic sensor is right next door at J5250.

Have you measured SMC_LID with the lid up and down?

threads.title: [SOLVED]MBP retina 2015 13’' 820-4924 won’t sleep
threads.message: Figured it was J5250, I just accidentally ripped it off just now, taking off all the pads except one. luckily most of them are not connected or ground. I have stuck it down with 2 jumpers on pin 6 and 7 also replaced R5250 and C5250. still no luck

threads.title: [SOLVED]MBP retina 2015 13’' 820-4924 won’t sleep
threads.message: Hold a magnet over the sensor and see if SMC_LID goes low. Check voltages on the Hall sensor chip.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MBP retina 2015 13’' 820-4924 won’t sleep
threads.message: Fixed the issue. problem was pin 6. although the pad was there the trace was fucked, i put a jumper.
